Method Detail

executeCommand

public byte[] executeCommand(int clientId,
                             long timestamp,
                             byte[] nonces,
                             byte[] command)
Description copied from class: ServiceReplica
This method is where the application code is to be written. It is meant to be implemented by subclasses of this class. The code for this method MUST use the value of "timestamp" instead of relying on its own local clock, and "nonces" instead of trying to generated its own random values. This is important because this values are the same for all replicas, and therefore, ensure the determinism required in a replicated state machine. It is crucial for the programmer to be aware of this.

Specified by:
executeCommand in class ServiceReplica
Parameters:
clientId - The ID of the client that issue the request
timestamp - A timestamp to be used by the application, in case it needs it
nonces - Random values to be used by the application, in case it needs them
command - The command issue by the client
Returns:
the reply for the request issued by the client
